snippet: The mayor of Flint has declared a state of emergency because of problems with the city’s water system caused by using water from the Flint River, saying the city needs more federal help.
abstract: Flint, Mich, Mayor Karen Weaver declares state of emergency and requests federal aid for problems related to city water system's use of polluted Flint River; anticipates increased city spending on mental health services due to irreversible effects of lead exposure on children.
lead_paragraph: The mayor of Flint has declared a state of emergency because of problems with the city’s water system caused by using water from the Flint River, saying the city needs more federal help.
